topics.title: Percentages, Profit & Loss
topics.description: Understanding percentages, conversions, profit, loss, discount, and simple interest

contents.title: Introduction to Percentages
contents.content:
Percentage means 'per hundred' or 'out of 100'. The symbol % represents percentage.

Key Concepts:
â€¢ 1% = 1/100 = 0.01
â€¢ 50% = 50/100 = 1/2 = 0.5
â€¢ 100% = 100/100 = 1 (whole)
â€¢ 200% = 200/100 = 2 (double)

Conversions:

1. Fraction to Percentage:
   â€¢ Multiply by 100
   â€¢ Formula: (Fraction Ã— 100)%
   â€¢ Example: 3/4 = (3/4 Ã— 100)% = 75%

2. Decimal to Percentage:
   â€¢ Multiply by 100
   â€¢ Example: 0.75 = 0.75 Ã— 100 = 75%

3. Percentage to Fraction:
   â€¢ Divide by 100
   â€¢ Simplify
   â€¢ Example: 25% = 25/100 = 1/4

4. Percentage to Decimal:
   â€¢ Divide by 100
   â€¢ Example: 45% = 45/100 = 0.45

Common Percentages:
â€¢ 10% = 1/10 = 0.1
â€¢ 20% = 1/5 = 0.2
â€¢ 25% = 1/4 = 0.25
â€¢ 50% = 1/2 = 0.5
â€¢ 75% = 3/4 = 0.75
â€¢ 100% = 1

contents.title: Calculating Percentages
contents.content:
Finding Percentage of a Number:

Example 1: Find 20% of 500
Method 1:
20% of 500 = 20/100 Ã— 500
= 20 Ã— 5
= 100

Method 2:
20% = 0.20
0.20 Ã— 500 = 100

Answer: 100

Example 2: Find 15% of 800
15% of 800 = 15/100 Ã— 800
= 15 Ã— 8
= 120

Answer: 120

Finding What Percent:

Example 3: 25 is what percent of 200?
Percent = (Part/Whole) Ã— 100
= (25/200) Ã— 100
= 0.125 Ã— 100
= 12.5%

Answer: 12.5%

Example 4: 45 is what percent of 150?
= (45/150) Ã— 100
= 0.3 Ã— 100
= 30%

Answer: 30%

Finding the Whole:

Example 5: 30% of what number is 90?
Let number = x
30% of x = 90
30/100 Ã— x = 90
x = 90 Ã— 100/30
x = 300

Answer: 300

examples.title: Percentage Increase/Decrease
examples.code:
Example 1: Increase
A number increases from 80 to 100. Find percentage increase.

Solution:
Increase = New - Old = 100 - 80 = 20
Percentage increase = (Increase/Original) Ã— 100
= (20/80) Ã— 100
= 25%

Answer: 25% increase

Example 2: Decrease
Price decreases from â‚¹500 to â‚¹400. Find percentage decrease.

Solution:
Decrease = 500 - 400 = 100
Percentage decrease = (Decrease/Original) Ã— 100
= (100/500) Ã— 100
= 20%

Answer: 20% decrease
examples.explanation: Always calculate percentage change based on the original (old) value, not the new value.

contents.title: Profit and Loss
contents.content:
Profit and Loss deals with buying and selling of goods.

Key Terms:
â€¢ Cost Price (CP): Price at which item is bought
â€¢ Selling Price (SP): Price at which item is sold
â€¢ Profit: When SP > CP
â€¢ Loss: When CP > SP
â€¢ Marked Price (MP): Price marked on item
â€¢ Discount: Reduction in marked price

Formulas:

1. Profit = SP - CP (when SP > CP)
2. Loss = CP - SP (when CP > SP)

3. Profit% = (Profit/CP) Ã— 100
4. Loss% = (Loss/CP) Ã— 100

5. SP = CP + Profit
6. SP = CP - Loss

7. SP = CP(100 + Profit%)/100
8. SP = CP(100 - Loss%)/100

9. CP = (SP Ã— 100)/(100 + Profit%)
10. CP = (SP Ã— 100)/(100 - Loss%)

Discount:
â€¢ Discount = MP - SP
â€¢ Discount% = (Discount/MP) Ã— 100
â€¢ SP = MP - Discount
â€¢ SP = MP(100 - Discount%)/100

contents.title: Profit and Loss Problems
contents.content:
Example 1: Finding Profit
CP = â‚¹500, SP = â‚¹600. Find profit and profit%.

Solution:
Profit = SP - CP
= 600 - 500
= â‚¹100

Profit% = (Profit/CP) Ã— 100
= (100/500) Ã— 100
= 20%

Answer: Profit = â‚¹100, Profit% = 20%

Example 2: Finding Loss
CP = â‚¹800, SP = â‚¹720. Find loss and loss%.

Solution:
Loss = CP - SP
= 800 - 720
= â‚¹80

Loss% = (Loss/CP) Ã— 100
= (80/800) Ã— 100
= 10%

Answer: Loss = â‚¹80, Loss% = 10%

Example 3: Finding SP from Profit%
CP = â‚¹1,200, Profit% = 25%. Find SP.

Solution:
SP = CP(100 + Profit%)/100
= 1200(100 + 25)/100
= 1200 Ã— 125/100
= 1200 Ã— 1.25
= â‚¹1,500

Answer: SP = â‚¹1,500

Example 4: Finding CP from Loss%
SP = â‚¹900, Loss% = 10%. Find CP.

Solution:
CP = (SP Ã— 100)/(100 - Loss%)
= (900 Ã— 100)/(100 - 10)
= 90000/90
= â‚¹1,000

Answer: CP = â‚¹1,000

examples.title: Discount Problems
examples.code:
Problem: A shirt marked at â‚¹800 is sold at 20% discount. Find:
a) Discount amount
b) Selling price

Solution:
MP = â‚¹800
Discount% = 20%

a) Discount = MP Ã— Discount%/100
= 800 Ã— 20/100
= â‚¹160

b) SP = MP - Discount
= 800 - 160
= â‚¹640

Or directly:
SP = MP(100 - Discount%)/100
= 800 Ã— 80/100
= â‚¹640

Answer: a) â‚¹160, b) â‚¹640
examples.explanation: Discount is always calculated on Marked Price, not Cost Price. Selling Price = Marked Price - Discount.

contents.title: Simple Interest
contents.content:
Simple Interest is the interest calculated on the original principal amount.

Key Terms:
â€¢ Principal (P): Original amount borrowed/invested
â€¢ Rate (R): Interest rate per year (%)
â€¢ Time (T): Duration in years
â€¢ Simple Interest (SI): Interest earned/paid
â€¢ Amount (A): Principal + Interest

Formulas:

1. SI = (P Ã— R Ã— T)/100

2. Amount = Principal + SI
   A = P + SI

3. P = (SI Ã— 100)/(R Ã— T)

4. R = (SI Ã— 100)/(P Ã— T)

5. T = (SI Ã— 100)/(P Ã— R)

Important Points:
â€¢ Time must be in years
â€¢ If time in months: T = months/12
â€¢ If time in days: T = days/365
â€¢ Rate is always per annum (per year)
â€¢ SI is calculated on original principal only

contents.title: Simple Interest Problems
contents.content:
Example 1: Finding SI
P = â‚¹5,000, R = 10% per annum, T = 2 years. Find SI and Amount.

Solution:
SI = (P Ã— R Ã— T)/100
= (5000 Ã— 10 Ã— 2)/100
= 100000/100
= â‚¹1,000

Amount = P + SI
= 5000 + 1000
= â‚¹6,000

Answer: SI = â‚¹1,000, Amount = â‚¹6,000

Example 2: Finding Principal
SI = â‚¹600, R = 12%, T = 2 years. Find P.

Solution:
P = (SI Ã— 100)/(R Ã— T)
= (600 Ã— 100)/(12 Ã— 2)
= 60000/24
= â‚¹2,500

Answer: Principal = â‚¹2,500

Example 3: Finding Rate
P = â‚¹8,000, SI = â‚¹1,200, T = 3 years. Find R.

Solution:
R = (SI Ã— 100)/(P Ã— T)
= (1200 Ã— 100)/(8000 Ã— 3)
= 120000/24000
= 5%

Answer: Rate = 5% per annum

Example 4: Time in Months
P = â‚¹10,000, R = 15%, T = 8 months. Find SI.

Solution:
T = 8/12 years = 2/3 years

SI = (P Ã— R Ã— T)/100
= (10000 Ã— 15 Ã— 2)/(100 Ã— 3)
= 300000/300
= â‚¹1,000

Answer: SI = â‚¹1,000

examples.title: Real-Life Application
examples.code:
Problem: Raj deposits â‚¹25,000 in a bank at 8% simple interest per annum. How much money will he get after 3 years?

Solution:
P = â‚¹25,000
R = 8%
T = 3 years

SI = (P Ã— R Ã— T)/100
= (25000 Ã— 8 Ã— 3)/100
= 600000/100
= â‚¹6,000

Amount = P + SI
= 25000 + 6000
= â‚¹31,000

Answer: Raj will get â‚¹31,000 after 3 years.
examples.explanation: Simple interest is used in loans, deposits, and investments. Amount received = Principal + Interest earned.
